example.name: immortalize-v
example.text: One sip from the fountain of youth immortalized him.
example.arg: One sip from the fountain of youth

example.name: immortalizing-n
example.text: This therefore obliged them [the Sadducees] to deny the actual Immortalizing of either Angels or Humane Souls, when they denied them Both that Spirit which which could alone immortalize them.
example.arg: of either Angels or Humane Souls

example.name: immortalization-n
example.text: In the case of the hero Achilles, a myth about his immortalization after death is made explicit in the epic Cycle, where Achilles is immortalized after death.

example.name: immortalizing-j
example.text: It is this life which the poets nourish for him, and sustain with their immortalizing nectar.

roleset.name: cause to be eternally remembered, perhaps with veneration

example.name: immortalize-v
example.text: []King Solomon]-1 was immortalized *-1 for saving a baby's life by threatening to split it between the real mother and a pretender.
example.arg: for saving a baby's life by threatening to split it between the real mother and a pretender

example.name: immortalized-j
example.text: There is no street named after Neal Cassady in Denver yet, but he is immortalized in Jack's writings.

roleset.name: mutation of cells resulting in a cell line that can keep undergoing division indefinitely

example.name: immortalize-v
example.text: They then immortalized the cells, using a hybrid virus (AD12 SV40) and finally transformed them with a murine sarcoma virus (Kristen virus).

example.name: immortalization-n
example.text: Selective immortalization of tumor-specific T cells to establish long-term T-cell lines maintaining primary cell characteristics.

example.name: immortal-j
example.text: Every sacred tie that binds life to life, that links heart to heart, that draws mind to mind, be the tie political, be it social, be it domestic, is immortal.
example.arg: Every sacred tie that binds life to life, that links heart to heart, that draws mind to mind, be the tie political, be it social, be it domestic,
